main.name: Hi, I'm Odwa Nolusiba Ntloko
main.description: And I'm a Software engineer. This site tells you a biiiit more about me ... :)
main.bio: I’m a software engineer who loves working with the full technology stack, from front to backend and everything inbetween. I enjoy seeing myself do magic with code and the reactions of the people I'm working with when they see my work. Most importantly, I looove solving problems and I'm always eager to learn new languages/frameworks. Overall I’m passionate about technology and excited about the future.
main.hobbies: I'm born and raised in Cape Town. One of my favourite things to do in the world is going to the beach and being surrounded by water. I also enjoy visiting our local vineyards and going for wine tastings. I love-love-love attending concerts/live performances. But with concerts not really being a thing anymore, my new favourite love is horseback riding.  I enjoy attending tech meetups and being part of the bigger tech community.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

work.title: Intermediate Software Engineer
work.description: In my current role, I work on Go-lang microservices and some react portals for the Checkers Sixty60 app. I deliver on my sprint targets while maintaining coding standards.

work.title: Specialist: Automation & Transformation Developer
work.description: In this role I was a software developer who continues to work across the fullstack of web applications. I develop web applications using reactJS for their front-end and build microservices using nodeJS. I perform code reviews to ensure that the standards of our software development team are being met. I provide support for new people who join the team and help them get started in our team.

work.title: Discover Graduate Trainee - Software Engineer
work.description: During the program I was exposed to different parts and technologies in the business. The first part of the business I was exposed to was our RPA division where I learnt process behind automating repetive tasks for 3 months. I was then exposed to the financial services industry and developed an application which reduced the turn around time of short term insurance claims from 2 hours to 15 minutes. I spent 3 months in the financial services team. I then worked worked with the Vodacom chatbot team and supporting tribe teams for the rest of the 2 year program. I started out working on the reporting for the team building angular dashboard views for different stakeholders. I have since been building other types of internal web application tools and their backends for stakeholders within our tribe. I've also built a few of the chatbot microservices depending on the business needs. The tech stack I've been using is ReactJS, NodeJS, Oracle SQL developer, bitbucket and redhat openshift.

work.title: Intern Associate Software Engineer
work.description: I had to create a Django CRUD application from start to finish (Fullstack). I started by designing the database structure for how the data would be stored. The data was in the form of a CSV and an Excel file which was related to eachother. I then created python scripts to merge the 2 data sources into a single data-structure and then wrote the data to the database structure I designed in the beginning. This was a Microsoft SQL server database. A user was then able to Create, Read, Update and Delete the data through the web-interface. The REST methods were defined within the Django part of the project.

education.degree: BSc Computer Science and Computer Engineering
education.experience: My first year at varsity was very challenging. In fact, I even had 2 "first years". I spent most of my 1st first year being overwhelmed by the environment, the workload and by the fact that it felt like I was the only one in my class that hadn't done any programming in high school. At some point, I even felt that maybe Tech wasn't for me and that the university had made a mistake accepting me to study Computer Science. However, towards the end of the year, the more I met people who felt the same way I did, the more 'normal' I felt, and the more I was able to overcome my anxieties and perform better in my academics. By the end of the following year, I obtained a distinction in one of my most challenging subjects and even became a tutor for it.
education.e1: I then joined the UCT Developer Society and the Women in Computer Science Society. Where I would meet-up with other aspiring developers and talk about the future. I also became a Computer Science Mentor to try and help first years adjust to university as smoothly as possible
education.e2: Overall, I had a lot of ups and downs at university, but it was one of the best experiences and learning curves in my life.
education.description: I learnt a lot during this degree so I won't even try to name everything. The languages/tools I used include Java; Python; C & C++; SQL; Assembly. I also did a Machine Learning module.
